title: Homeopathic treatments for IBS: Natural remedies and more
author: Beth Sissons
description: Some treatments for irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) in homeopathy may help relieve a person's symptoms. Learn more here.
cleaned_text: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a gastrointestinal disorder. Some homeopathic treatments may help ease symptoms such as abdominal pain, irregular bowel movements, and bloating. Homeopathy is an alternative medicine system that uses small amounts of natural substances to promote the body's own healing process. Homeopathy looks at the person as a whole, taking into account the root causes and emotions behind the condition. Because of this, treatments will be different depending on the individual. This article looks at how homeopaths treat [IBS](/articles/37063), as well as some conventional treatments. IBS is a disorder that affects the gastrointestinal (GI) tract. A [2019 review](https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD009710.pub3/full) that looked at the effects of homeopathic remedies in 307 people with IBS was unable to conclude that they were safe or effective. This section looks at some homeopathic treatments for IBS. Treatments will be different depending on the individual, so people should not try to treat themselves at home. Natrum muraticum Another [2019 study](https://www.ijsr.net/archive/v9i11/SR201110002048.pdf) used natrum muraticum to treat patients with IBS. It found that treatment with this, nux vomica, arsenic album, or lycopodium resulted in some level of improvement in 48 out of 50 cases. Natrum muraticum is a remedy derived from table salt. A person can buy it in pill or liquid form online or in specialized stores. Arsenic album Arsenic album is another homeopathic remedy that the [2019 study](https://www.ijsr.net/archive/v9i11/SR201110002048.pdf) found to be successful in improving IBS symptoms. It is a diluted form of a chemical called arsenic trioxide. A person can purchase it online or in specialized stores in pill or liquid form. Some studies have shown that certain homeopathic remedies, such as nux vomica, asafoetida, lycopodium clavatum, natrum muraticum, and arsenic album may help improve symptoms of IBS. A person should consult a doctor before they decide to pursue homeopathic remedies to treat their IBS. A doctor can advise on the best approach. A person should also tell a doctor about any supplements or remedies they are considering taking, in case they interact with any pre-existing medications. Once approved by a doctor, a person can consult a professional homeopath and devise a treatment plan with them.
